unit: Unit 8 | Inference for Categorical Data: Chi-Square
title: Test the Tires
question_text: One-hundred automobile tires are to be randomly tested. More information for $5$ testing situations are given below. Which one best describes a chi-square test for independence?

choices.text: A tire consumer company publishes the percentage of tires sold of each given size of tire. Do these $100$ match the given distribution?
These tires will be followed for five years. Will the percentage of them still on the road surpass the industry standard of $5$ years?
Fifty tires each will be chosen from all-season and high performance tires. They will be followed and after $5$ year the number of tires still on the road will be compared for the two tire types.

The tires will be designated as all-season or high performance from one factory. After $10,000$ miles driven the amount of wear will be determined to be excellent, good, or poor. Is there an association between tire type and wear?
